newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-MIM says half Alumbrera output sold.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-MIM says half Alumbrera output sold.

text.p: MIM Holdings Ltd said on Friday that half the annual output from the Alumbrera copper mine in Argentina has been sold to three companies under long term contracts.
"We have now signed firm contracts covering half of the planned production," Peter Freund, MIM's executive general manager for Alumbrera said.
The three companies that signed the contracts are Finland's Outokumpu Oy, Nippon Mining Co of Japan and South Koreas LG Metals Corp.
Alumbrera is scheduled to start production in the second quarter of 1997, working up to an annual rate of 700,000 tonnes of intermediate mine concentrate containing 180,000 tonnes of copper metal.
"Those three customers alone account for annual contracts of about half the total production," Freund said.
"We're very close to completing contracts for the balance of the 85 percent we intend to have on firm long-term contracts," he said.
Freund said it was normal to reserve about 15 percent of production to sell on the spot market.
MIM is 50 percent owner and operator of Alumbrera. North Ltd and Rio Algom Ltd own 25 percent each.
Freund also said the US$903 million project was running at budget and ahead of schedule.
Copper concentrate mined at Alumbrera was particularly attractive to tradional copper smelters, Freund said.
"It's a very clean product, which provides a good base load fee," he said.
Distribution of material from Alumbrera would be virtually worldwide, Freund said.
Letters of intent already have been received from potential customers in Europe, Scandanavia, North and South America, India and Asia.
